text: Henri Landwirth (March 7, 1927 - April 16, 2018) was a Belgian-American hotelier and philanthropist. He was the founder of Give Kids The World and Dignity U Wear. He was born in Antwerp, Belgium. He was a Holocaust survivor. Landwirth first worked in New York City and then in 1954 became manager of the Starlight Motel in Cocoa Beach, Florida. He owned the Seralago Hotel & Suites Main Gate East near Orlando, Florida.The history of Seralago Hotel & Suites at SeralagoHotel.com Landwirth died at his Jacksonville, Florida home on April 16, 2018 at the age of 91. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from mesothelioma Category:Cancer deaths in Florida Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:American philanthropists Category:Holocaust survivors Category:Businesspeople from Orlando, Florida Category:People from Antwerp
title: Henri Landwirth
